page.title: 03Education in Toppesfield
page.content: Most children from Toppesfield and Stambourne begin their education at the Play Group held in Toppesfield Village Hall.At the age of five they go to St Margaret's C of E Primary school,Toppesfield.There was a school in Stambourne but it was closed down because there were insufficient children.Because Toppesfield school was the biggest everybody had to go there.The school was built in 1856 and was extended and modernised in 1980.There are 79 pupils and 3 teachers in the school.There is a school bus that brings some children free if they live over 2 miles from the school and some others come on it but they have to pay.At the age of 11 pupils go to a secondary school in Hedingham about 5 miles away. A few children go to Grammar school but they have to travel a long way.
